chapters.storyText: You awaken in a strange village, your armor tarnished and your sword broken. The villagers whisper about a fallen knight, but you remember nothing. Only the weight of failure haunts your heart.
dialogues: Village Elder: 'Stranger, you appeared at our gates three days ago, unconscious and wounded.'
You: 'I... I can't remember anything. Who am I?'
Village Elder: 'Your armor bears the crest of the Royal Knights, but it has been defaced. What happened to you?'
You: 'I don't know. But I will find out.'

chapters.storyText: Dreams of a grand castle and a terrible betrayal plague your sleep. The Ancient Ruins beckon, promising answers to questions you didn't know you had. Within those crumbling walls lies the truth of your fall from grace.
dialogues: Mysterious Voice: 'Do you remember your oath, knight?'
Mysterious Voice: 'You swore to protect the innocent, yet you failed. The blood on your hands can never be washed away.'
You: 'No... that's not true! I would never...'
Mysterious Voice: 'Then prove it. Face the truth in the ruins.'

chapters.storyText: The shadow of your past stands before you - a dark reflection born from your greatest failure. It was not betrayal that caused your fall, but hesitation. In a moment of doubt, innocents died. Now you must defeat this manifestation of guilt to reclaim your honor.
dialogues: Shadow Self: 'You cannot escape what you've done.'
You: 'I don't seek to escape it. I seek to make amends.'
Shadow Self: 'Amends? The dead cannot forgive.'
You: 'Then I will live to ensure no one else suffers as they did. I am not the knight I was - I am something more!'
Shadow Self: 'Then show me... show me your resolve!'
You: 'I accept my past. I will carry this burden and transform it into strength. I am the Fallen Knight - redeemed!'
